snippet: Labor experts and government officials say that traditional apprenticeship programs, popular in Europe, could help sustain burgeoning growth in American factories.
abstract: Labor experts and government officials say traditional apprenticeship programs, popular in Europe, could help sustain burgeoning growth in American factories; Tognum America has enrolled students from local high schools near its South Carolina factory in an apprenticeship program; BMW's plant in Greer, SC, its only one in United States, offers program that allows young workers to study at technical colleges and work.

byline.contributor: Jack Ewing contributed reporting from Frankfurt.

lead_paragraph: Labor experts and government officials say that traditional apprenticeship programs, popular in Europe, could help sustain burgeoning growth in American factories.

headline.main: Where Factory Apprenticeship Is Latest Model From Germany
headline.print_headline: Where Factory Apprenticeship Is Latest Model From Germany
